result.execSummary:
The defendant Mark A. OFFIELD was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Under the Huber Law, concurrent with all sentences imposed in 14 CF 86 and 14 CF 47, but consecutive to the sentence imposed on 13 CF 363.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mark A. OFFIELD

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant in custody.
On count 1, felony bail jumping, the defendant is sentenced to the Manitowoc County Jail for eight (8) months, under the Huber Law, concurrent with all sentences imposed in 14 CF 86 and 14 CF 47, but consecutive to the sentence imposed on 13 CF 363.
$518.00 court costs imposed.  $650.00 cash bail from 14 CF 86 and 14 CF 47 applied.  Balance to be applied to 14 CF 86.
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement.
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.
Minutes.
Defendant's Notice of Motion; Defendant's Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.

Defendant in custody.
NO CONTEST plea entered to count 1, bail jumping.  Convicted.
The State moves to dismiss and read in counts 2,3 and 4, two counts bail jumping and one count possess drug paraphernalia.  Motion granted.
Sentencing is set for 02-16-15 at 9:00 a.m.
Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights.
Minutes.

Defendant in custody.   
Defendant waives his right to a preliminary hearing. Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 1 for further proceedings.  Waiver of Right to Preliminary Hearing.   
ARRAIGNMENT
Information filed.  Not guilty pleas.  Jury Calendar.  Status conference set for 01-26-15 at 1:30 p.m.  State's Motion and Demand for Discovery.  
Minutes.

Defendant in custody.   
Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing is set for 01-21-15 at 2:00 p.m.   
Minutes.

Defendant in custody.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crimes of 2 counts bail jumping, obstruct officer, possess drug paraphernalia.  The matters are continued for initial appearance on 01-12-15 at 2:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $1,500.00 cash.  Cash bail not furnished and the defendant is remanded into custody.  Commitment for failure to furnish bail issued.  Copy filed.  
Probable Cause Statement and Judicial Determination.
Minutes.
